title: 109_hr5322
content: The "Retirement Enhancement Act of 2006" modifies limits on contributions to certain retirement accounts, increasing the deductible amount to $8,000 for taxable years 2007 or 2008, and $10,000 for 2009 and thereafter. The Retirement Enhancement Act of 2006 increases the deductible amount for retirement contributions to $10,000 after 2009. Additionally, individuals aged 50 or older can make catch-up contributions with an increased deductible amount of $2,000. The Retirement Enhancement Act of 2006 increases the deductible amount for retirement contributions to $10,000 after 2009. Furthermore, there is an increase in the limitation on deduction for active participants in certain pension plans, with specific dollar amounts set for joint and non-joint filers starting in 2007. The Retirement Enhancement Act of 2006 raises the deductible amount for retirement contributions to $10,000 after 2009. Additionally, there is an increase in the limitation on deduction for active participants in certain pension plans, with specific dollar amounts set for joint and non-joint filers starting in 2007. In 2007 or later, the applicable dollar amount is $150,000, with a cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years after 2007. The Retirement Enhancement Act of 2006 increases the deductible amount for retirement contributions to $10,000 after 2009. There is also an increase in the limitation on deduction for active participants in certain pension plans, with specific dollar amounts set for joint and non-joint filers starting in 2007. The cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years after 2007 is determined by substituting 'calendar year 2006' for 'calendar year 1992'. Rounding rules apply if the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $500. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the exclusion for elective deferrals to $30,000. The cost-of-living adjustment for section 402(g) is amended to $30,000. Catch-up contributions for certain plans are set at $10,000. The applicable dollar amount for Simple and 401(k) plans is reduced to $5,000. Inflation adjustments increase the amounts to $10,000 and $5,000. Elective deferrals to 457 plans are increased. In general, the eligible deferred compensation plan is amended to $30,000. A cost-of-living adjustment is made for taxable years after December 31, 2007, with the $30,000 amount being adjusted in the same manner as section 415(d). The dollar limit for defined contribution plans is increased from $40,000 to $80,000. Cost-of-living adjustments are also made, with the limit being adjusted to $80,000 and the effective date changed to July 1, 2006. The dollar limit for defined contribution plans is amended to $20,000, with cost-of-living adjustments changing the limit to $20,000 and the effective date to July 1, 2006. These amendments apply to years beginning after December 31, 2006. SEC. 3. ONE-TIME ELECTION TO APPLY HIGHER INCOME THRESHOLDS UNDER SAVERS CREDIT. SEC. 3. ONE-TIME ELECTION TO APPLY HIGHER INCOME THRESHOLDS UNDER SAVERS CREDIT. Amends Section 25B of the Internal Revenue Code to allow eligible individuals to apply higher income thresholds by electing to substitute 200 percent of specified dollar amounts for one taxable year. The amendment makes the nonrefundable credit for elective deferrals and IRA contributions permanent, repealing certain sections and applying to taxable years after December 31, 2006.
